TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:

I think that the problem is with Spacedock, not my browser, as I've downloaded other mods successfully with Edge and <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> isn't completing the download either.
Is it better to have scaled space ambient light disabled or not?

It appears that Spacedock is down. I've tried downloading with Edge and Chrome, and both aren't working. Chrome says that the server was unable to service my request, and <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> is giving an error that it can't reach the server too. Do you have another mirror download?

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, Drew Kerman said:
> 
> 
> this <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch will do the trick all by itself
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     @Kopernicus:FINAL
>     {
>       %Body[Sun]
>       {
>         %ScaledVersion
>         {
>           %Light
>           {
>             %sunLensFlareColor = 0, 0, 0, 0
>           }
>         }
>       }
>     }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> or... not? Hang on. Testing, I thought it was working before.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Ah, fixed it. Needed some % luvin. In fact I just changed them all to % to be safe
> 

How do you make a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch? Do I save it as a .txt file, or what?

The download proceeds to 4%, then an error message pops up saying that the download was interrupted. I then click resume, and the download time suddenly drops to a few minutes. When I try to extract the file, I get an error message saying that the zipped file is empty. It stops at the same place on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> too.

I also saw that another user was having the same issue, refer to the SVT thread for details. Sounds like exactly the same as my problem.

> 
> 
> On 9/10/2016 at 5:08 AM, Galileo said:
> 
> 
> Hey Blackrack, This isnt a pressing issue, am im sure its by design, but when you Rename the sun in Kopernicus, scatterer does not work properly. It removes the ocean and there is no atmospheric haze. Its not a big deal i just so happen to notice it :0 thats all. have a good one!
> 

Ah yes, the sun's name is hardcoded to "Sun" in scatterer, so if it can't find it, sun-related things don't work. I'll add a variable for it or make it auto-detect or something.

> 
> 
> On 9/11/2016 at 6:46 PM, Aegrim said:
> 
> 
> Is it better to have scaled space ambient light disabled or not?
> 

Better disabled imo (ie disable scaled space ambient light box ticked ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")). Usually I make the features that I think are worth it on by default.

Hi, sorry to bring this up again, but will there be any solution to the shoreline flickering problem? I haven't used scatterer since it started. I miss having scatterer, but to me, the shoreline flickering is worse than having no scatterer effects at all.

I reinstalled the most recent version recently and the problem is still there. Changed tons of settings like V-Sync, frame rate limit, changing program specific settings in Nvidia control panel... nothing fixed it.

Thanks, and I realize you're doing this all for free!

[Youtube link - example of shoreline flickering](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tyXiWeEtuq4)
